about.title: About the tutor
about.body: I‚Äôm Teodoro Morcone, a math tutor in Zurich and founder of Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe‚Äîa Business Economist (FH) and unabashed numbers person. Born in Zurich and raised in Ticino, I bridge the German- and Italian-speaking perspectives. I help students build solid foundations, train strategically for Gymnasium, BMS, HMS, and FMS admissions, and stay consistently engaged throughout the school year. My approach combines step-by-step explanations, tiered practice packets, realistic mock exams, and weekly progress tracking‚Äîplanned, measurable, effective. Lessons are delivered in German, Italian, and English, exclusively online via Zoom. Off the clock I‚Äôm into strength training and programming‚Äîthe same structured discipline flows directly into my tutoring.

items.question: How do reschedules and cancellations work?
items.answer: Gymnasium entrance exam prep sessions can be moved or cancelled free of charge up to 24 hours in advance. Late changes (< 24h) or no-shows are billed in full so that reserved slots remain available for other candidates.

items.question: What materials do you use?
items.answer: I blend proprietary practice sets, official Zurich education department papers, adaptive drills mapped to your diagnostic results, and annotated solution walk-throughs. All resources are shared digitally with versioned feedback.

items.question: Is tutoring exclusively online?
items.answer: Yes. Sessions run on Zoom with collaborative whiteboard work, breakout problem drills, and optional recordings of key solution frameworks so you can review afterwards.

items.question: How quickly do you respond to inquiries?
items.answer: Typically within 24 hours on business days you receive proposed time slots, a mini goal analysis, and‚Äîif helpful‚Äîa prep sheet to complete before the diagnostic call.

items.question: How do payments work?
items.answer: All lessons and packages are prepaid via Stripe payment link (e.g., card, Twint). Sessions are confirmed once the Stripe payment clears, and receipts are emailed automatically.

items.question: How is personal data handled?
items.answer: Personal data is processed solely for lesson delivery in line with Swiss revDSG. Analytics and tracking scripts load only after your consent, and Zoom recordings require written approval.

items.question: Do you cover specific BMS/HMS/FMS components?
items.answer: Yes. I cover the full competency profile for BMS, BM2, HMS, and FMS, including quantitative reasoning, essay prompts, and full-length simulations scored against official rubrics.

sections.heading: 1. Scope
body: These terms govern the contractual relationship between the Provider and clients who book mathematics tutoring or exam preparation.
Deviations apply only if confirmed in writing.

sections.heading: 2. Services & lesson format
body: Lessons take place exclusively online via Zoom.
Lesson content, scope, and learning objectives are agreed during the consultation or booking process.

sections.heading: 3. Contract formation & booking (Calendesk)
body: Appointments are requested and scheduled through Calendesk.
The lesson agreement is concluded directly between the client and the Provider.
Calendesk solely provides the technical booking and scheduling platform; Calendesk‚Äôs own terms apply without changing the tutoring relationship.

During each booking the client actively ticks a checkbox in Calendesk to confirm the linked version of these Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Notice; I log the version, date/time, IP address, and booking ID as proof.

sections.heading: 4. Prices, taxes & payment
body: The prices published on the website in CHF apply.
Taxes: tutoring services are generally exempt from Swiss VAT.
The Provider is currently not VAT-registered (annual revenue < CHF 100,000) and therefore does not charge VAT.
Payment: before the lesson via Stripe payment link (e.g., card, Twint).
Electronic receipts are provided; no additional payment fees apply.
Price basis: adjustments apply only to future bookings; confirmed appointments remain unchanged.

sections.heading: 5. Cancellation, rescheduling & no-shows
bullets: Free cancellation or rescheduling up to 24 hours before the booked start time (time zone: Europe/Zurich).

Cancellation or reschedule requests must be submitted either (a) via the Calendesk link in the reminder email or (b) by email to info@teodoro.ch. The timestamp on my systems (time zone Europe/Zurich) is decisive.
Cancellations or reschedules within 24 hours as well as no-shows are billed at 100% of the lesson fee.

Goodwill: once per calendar year a goodwill credit may be granted for justified circumstances beyond the client‚Äôs control (e.g., acute illness); suitable evidence such as a medical certificate or official order is required.
Late arrival: if the client arrives late, the lesson still ends at the scheduled time; no make-up time is owed.
Provider cancellation: no costs arise; prepaid amounts are credited or an alternative appointment is offered.

sections.heading: 6. Packages (validity & refunds)
body: Package credits remain valid for 12 months from the purchase date.
If a package is terminated early, completed lessons are recalculated at the current single-lesson rate and the remaining balance is refunded without the package discount.
On request I extend unused package credits once by up to 3 months (e.g., illness, change of school).

sections.heading: 7. Client responsibilities
body: Clients ensure punctuality, an appropriate learning environment, and functioning equipment (stable internet connection, camera, microphone).

sections.heading: 8. Lessons with minors
body: Learners under 16 require written consent from a parent or legal guardian.
Communication is preferably coordinated together with the guardians.
Full legal names of minors are not used in Zoom without consent.

sections.heading: 9. Materials, copyright & recordings
body: Materials supplied by the Provider are protected by copyright and may be used only for personal learning.
Unauthorised audio or video recordings of lessons are prohibited.
Recordings take place only with prior written consent from all participants; any shared recordings remain available for a limited time.

sections.heading: 10. Online lessons & technology
body: Both parties ensure a stable connection and working equipment.
In the event of technical issues, the lesson is extended proportionally or rescheduled free of charge; further claims are excluded.

sections.heading: 11. Liability
body: Liability for wilful misconduct or gross negligence remains reserved.
To the extent permitted by law, liability for slight negligence‚Äîexcept for personal injury‚Äîis excluded.
No guarantee is given for exam results or grades.
Mandatory statutory rights remain reserved.

sections.heading: 12. Withdrawal / refunds
body: No statutory general right of withdrawal applies to lessons already delivered.
Refunds follow sections 5 and 6 or apply if the Provider cancels.

sections.heading: 13. Privacy
body: The privacy notice published on the website applies in its current version.

sections.heading: 14. Governing law & jurisdiction
body: Mandatory consumer venues remain reserved.
Consumers may bring claims at their domicile.
For all other disputes, Zurich is the exclusive venue.
Swiss substantive law applies.

sections.heading: 15. Changes to these terms
body: The Provider may amend these terms at any time.
The version published at the time of booking applies.

privacy.title: Privacy Notice (Short Version with Mandatory Disclosures)

sections.heading: 1) Controller
body: Teodoro Morcone, sole proprietorship ¬´Teodoro Morcone Nachhilfe¬ª, is the controller under revFADP/GDPR.
bullets: Address: Eichb√ºhlstrasse 33, 8004 Zurich, Switzerland
Email: info@teodoro.ch

sections.heading: 2) Scope
body: This notice explains how I process personal data when you visit teodoro.ch, contact me, book lessons, take part in online tutoring, or complete payments.
For clients from the EU/EEA I additionally comply with the GDPR.

sections.heading: 3) Categories of personal data
body: Depending on the situation I process the following categories of personal data.
I do not intentionally collect special-category data (e.g., health data); please avoid sending sensitive information through unsecured channels.
bullets: Master data: name, contact details, preferred language, date/year of birth for minors, guardian details.
Communication data: contents of emails, chat/WhatsApp messages (incl. metadata).
Tutoring data: objectives, learning status, notes, assignments, mock exam results, shared whiteboard content.
Contract & payment data: bookings, timeslots, packages, invoicing and payment references (no storage of full card details).
Technical & security data: truncated IP addresses, device/browser information, log files, security events.
Consent data: records of your choices (timestamp, selection) for optional analytics/marketing/recordings.

sections.heading: 4) Purposes & legal bases
body: I use personal data for these purposes and rely on the following legal bases:
bullets: Contract performance and pre-contractual steps (lesson delivery, scheduling, communication, follow-up).
Legal obligations (e.g., bookkeeping retention duties).
Legitimate interests (service security, abuse prevention, quality assurance).
Consent‚Äîfor optional analytics/marketing or lesson recordings; you may withdraw consent at any time with future effect.

sections.heading: 5) Sources
body: I usually receive personal data directly from you or, for minors, from their guardians.
Additional technical logs are generated by the systems I operate.

sections.heading: 6) Recipients & processors
body: I cooperate with carefully selected service providers under written data processing agreements. For third-country transfers I use Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) or comparable safeguards.
bullets: Swiss private hosting (Switzerland): servers/backups, security and access logs.
Calendesk (EU): scheduling, reminders, payment status (EU data centres).
Zoom (EU data residency enabled, HQ USA): video lessons with waiting rooms/passcodes; recordings only with consent, deleted within 30 days.
Stripe (EU/USA): payment processing; card details remain with Stripe.
Google Workspace & Gmail (EU/USA): email, documents; SCCs and, where available, Swiss-U.S. DPF.
Google Analytics 4 (optional, EU/USA): statistics with IP truncation; runs only after opt-in.
Meta Pixel (optional, USA): campaign measurement; runs only after opt-in.

sections.heading: 7) Cookies, analytics & marketing
body: Optional analytics or marketing pixels load only after explicit consent.
Consent logs (timestamp, choice, pseudonymous ID) are stored in a tamper-resistant manner.
You can change or withdraw consents at any time via the footer link without affecting essential services.
bullets: Essential: operation, security, consent storage.
Analytics (optional, e.g., GA4): reach and diagnostics with IP truncation; opt-in required.
Marketing (optional, e.g., Meta Pixel): campaign measurement; opt-in required.

sections.heading: 8) Communication channels
body: Standard channels are email and phone.
WhatsApp is used for scheduling; please avoid sending sensitive learning/health information.
Zoom uses waiting rooms and passcodes; recordings happen only with prior approval and are deleted within 30 days.

sections.heading: 9) Retention & deletion
body: I delete or anonymise personal data once the purpose is fulfilled or no legal obligation prevents it.
bullets: Enquiries without lessons: deleted within 12 months.
Active learner files/notes/materials: up to 3 years after the final lesson.
Accounting & payment records: 10 years.
Consent/cookie logs: 5 years.
Security logs: rotated after 12 months.
Backups: overwritten during the next scheduled maintenance cycle.

sections.heading: 10) Data security
body: I implement technical and organisational measures such as TLS encryption, IP truncation, role/rights management, access controls, logging of security events, and backup/restore processes.
If a breach poses a likely high risk, I notify the FDPIC without delay and inform affected individuals where required.

sections.heading: 11) Your rights
body: Depending on the applicable law you may exercise these rights. Send requests to info@teodoro.ch; I verify your identity proportionately and usually respond within 30 days (extendable by up to 30 days for complex matters).
bullets: Access.
Rectification.
Erasure (right to be forgotten).
Restriction of processing.
Data portability.
Objection to processing based on legitimate interests.
Withdrawal of consent with future effect.

sections.heading: 12) Automated decisions
body: I do not carry out automated individual decisions or profiling.

sections.heading: 13) Minors
body: Learners under 16 need written guardian consent.
Full legal names of minors are used in Zoom only with explicit approval.

sections.heading: 14) Changes to this notice
body: I may update this privacy notice at any time. The version published at the time of your visit or booking (see date above) applies.

sections.heading: 15) Supervision
body: Not satisfied? You may contact the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
